metadata.title: CVE-2019-13752 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Out of bounds read in SQLite in Google Chrome prior to 79.0.3945.79 alloweda remote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from processmemory via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

lemon - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.4
libsqlite3-0 - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.4
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.4
sqlite3 - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
sqlite: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
sqlite3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-1ubuntu1.4').
